text: How do people handle infinite's in the wild? Like one infinite can be smaller than another, or whatever, but it's still infinite. Does it only matter if you like go on to do cesaro summations or do these kinds of problems "commonly" arise in applied fields too? Seems like they would...

elements.text: How do people handle infinite's in the wild? Like one infinite can be smaller than another, or whatever, but it's still infinite. Does it only matter if you like go on to do cesaro summations or do these kinds of problems "commonly" arise in applied fields too? Seems like they would...

text: I’m not sure those problems ever arise in applied fields. But you may be looking for <https://github.com/JuliaMath/Infinities.jl>
